item.title: Another post
item.description: Using purr for functional library(purrr) mtcars %>% split(.$cyl) %>% map(~ lm(mpg ~ wt, data = .x)) %>% map(coef) ## $`4` ## (Intercept) wt ## 39.571196 -5.647025 ## ## $`6` ## (Intercept) wt ## 28.408845 -2.780106 ## ## $`8` ## (Intercept) wt ## 23.868029 -2.192438

item.title: Rmakrdown test
item.description: A simple Rmarkdown test Load the tidyverse library(tidyverse) Use the diamonds dataset: diamonds ## # A tibble: 53,940 x 10 ## carat cut color clarity depth table price x y z ## <dbl> <ord> <ord> <ord> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> ## 1 0.23 Ideal E SI2 61.5 55 326 3.95 3.98 2.43 ## 2 0.21 Premium E SI1 59.8 61 326 3.89 3.84 2.31 ## 3 0.23 Good E VS1 56.
